name: servicename
description_lines: Name for the GSLB service. Must begin with an ASCII alphanumeric or underscore (_) character, and must contain only ASCII alphanumeric, underscore, hash (#), period (.), space, colon (:), at (@), equals (=), and hyphen (-) characters. Can be changed after the GSLB service is created.
CLI Users: If the name includes one or more spaces, enclose the name in double or single quotation marks (for example, "my gslbsvc" or 'my gslbsvc').

name: cnameentry
description_lines: Canonical name of the GSLB service. Used in CNAME-based GSLB.

name: ip
description_lines: IP address for the GSLB service. Should represent a load balancing, content switching, or VPN virtual server on the NetScaler appliance, or the IP address of another load balancing device.

name: servername
description_lines: Name of the server hosting the GSLB service.

name: servicetype
description_lines: Possible values = HTTP, FTP, TCP, UDP, SSL, SSL_BRIDGE, SSL_TCP, NNTP, ANY, SIP_UDP, SIP_TCP, SIP_SSL, RADIUS, RDP, RTSP, MYSQL, MSSQL, ORACLE

name: port
description_lines: Port on which the load balancing entity represented by this GSLB service listens.
* in CLI is represented as 65535 in NITRO API

name: publicip
description_lines: The public IP address that a NAT device translates to the GSLB service's private IP address. Optional.

name: publicport
description_lines: The public port associated with the GSLB service's public IP address. The port is mapped to the service's private port number. Applicable to the local GSLB service. Optional.

name: maxclient
description_lines: The maximum number of open connections that the service can support at any given time. A GSLB service whose connection count reaches the maximum is not considered when a GSLB decision is made, until the connection count drops below the maximum.

name: healthmonitor
description_lines: Monitor the health of the GSLB service.

name: sitename
description_lines: Name of the GSLB site to which the service belongs.

name: cip
description_lines: In the request that is forwarded to the GSLB service, insert a header that stores the client's IP address. Client IP header insertion is used in connection-proxy based site persistence.

name: cipheader
description_lines: Name for the HTTP header that stores the client's IP address. Used with the Client IP option. If client IP header insertion is enabled on the service and a name is not specified for the header, the NetScaler appliance uses the name specified by the cipHeader parameter in the set ns param command or, in the GUI, the Client IP Header parameter in the Configure HTTP Parameters dialog box.

name: sitepersistence
description_lines: Use cookie-based site persistence. Applicable only to HTTP and SSL GSLB services.

name: cookietimeout
description_lines: Timeout value, in minutes, for the cookie, when cookie based site persistence is enabled.

name: siteprefix
description_lines: The site's prefix string. When the service is bound to a GSLB virtual server, a GSLB site domain is generated internally for each bound service-domain pair by concatenating the site prefix of the service and the name of the domain. If the special string NONE is specified, the site-prefix string is unset. When implementing HTTP redirect site persistence, the NetScaler appliance redirects GSLB requests to GSLB services by using their site domains.

name: clttimeout
description_lines: Idle time, in seconds, after which a client connection is terminated. Applicable if connection proxy based site persistence is used.

name: svrtimeout
description_lines: Idle time, in seconds, after which a server connection is terminated. Applicable if connection proxy based site persistence is used.

name: maxbandwidth
description_lines: Integer specifying the maximum bandwidth allowed for the service. A GSLB service whose bandwidth reaches the maximum is not considered when a GSLB decision is made, until its bandwidth consumption drops below the maximum.

name: downstateflush
description_lines: Flush all active transactions associated with the GSLB service when its state transitions from UP to DOWN. Do not enable this option for services that must complete their transactions. Applicable if connection proxy based site persistence is used.

name: maxaaausers
description_lines: Maximum number of SSL VPN users that can be logged on concurrently to the VPN virtual server that is represented by this GSLB service. A GSLB service whose user count reaches the maximum is not considered when a GSLB decision is made, until the count drops below the maximum.

name: monthreshold
description_lines: Monitoring threshold value for the GSLB service. If the sum of the weights of the monitors that are bound to this GSLB service and are in the UP state is not equal to or greater than this threshold value, the service is marked as DOWN.

name: hashid
description_lines: Unique hash identifier for the GSLB service, used by hash based load balancing methods.

name: comment
description_lines: Any comments that you might want to associate with the GSLB service.

name: naptrreplacement
description_lines: The replacement domain name for this NAPTR.

name: naptrorder
description_lines: An integer specifying the order in which the NAPTR records MUST be processed in order to accurately represent the ordered list of Rules. The ordering is from lowest to highest.

name: naptrservices
description_lines: Service Parameters applicable to this delegation path.

name: naptrdomainttl
description_lines: Modify the TTL of the internally created naptr domain.

name: naptrpreference
description_lines: An integer specifying the preference of this NAPTR among NAPTR records having same order. lower the number, higher the preference.

name: ipaddress
description_lines: The new IP address of the service.

name: viewname
description_lines: Name of the DNS view of the service. A DNS view is used in global server load balancing (GSLB) to return a predetermined IP address to a specific group of clients, which are identified by using a DNS policy.

name: viewip
description_lines: IP address to be used for the given view.

name: weight
description_lines: Weight to assign to the monitor-service binding. A larger number specifies a greater weight. Contributes to the monitoring threshold, which determines the state of the service.

name: monitor_name_svc
description_lines: Name of the monitor to bind to the service.

name: newname
description_lines: New name for the GSLB service.

choices: DOWN WHEN GOING OUT OF SERVICE
name: svrstate
description_lines: Possible values = UP, DOWN, UNKNOWN, BUSY, OUT OF SERVICE, GOING OUT OF SERVICE, DOWN WHEN GOING OUT OF SERVICE, NS_EMPTY_STR, Unknown, DISABLED

choices: DOWN WHEN GOING OUT OF SERVICE
name: svreffgslbstate
description_lines: Effective state of the gslb svc.
Possible values = UP, DOWN, UNKNOWN, BUSY, OUT OF SERVICE, GOING OUT OF SERVICE, DOWN WHEN GOING OUT OF SERVICE, NS_EMPTY_STR, Unknown, DISABLED

name: gslbthreshold
description_lines: Indicates if gslb svc has reached threshold.

name: gslbsvcstats
description_lines: Indicates if gslb svc has stats of the primary or the whole chain.

name: monstate
description_lines: State of the monitor bound to gslb service.

choices: DOWN WHEN GOING OUT OF SERVICE
name: monitor_state
description_lines: The running state of the monitor on this service.
Possible values = UP, DOWN, UNKNOWN, BUSY, OUT OF SERVICE, GOING OUT OF SERVICE, DOWN WHEN GOING OUT OF SERVICE, NS_EMPTY_STR, Unknown, DISABLED

name: statechangetimesec
description_lines: Time when last state change happened. Seconds part.

name: tickssincelaststatechange
description_lines: Time in 10 millisecond ticks since the last state change.

name: clmonowner
description_lines: Tells the mon owner of the gslb service.

name: clmonview
description_lines: Tells the view id of the monitoring owner.
